name: sun
description: The center of our solar system and the source of light and energy.
interesting_facts: The Sun is a nearly perfect sphere due to its fluid-like state.
Its energy is generated through nuclear fusion in its core.

name: mercury
description: The closest planet to the Sun, characterized by extreme temperatures and a lack of atmosphere.
interesting_facts: Mercury has a very thin atmosphere, so it cannot retain heat well.
It experiences the greatest temperature variations in the solar system.

name: venus
composition: Rocky with a thick toxic atmosphere
description: Venus is a scorching planet with a runaway greenhouse effect, making it the hottest planet in our solar system.
interesting_facts: Its atmosphere is mostly carbon dioxide, causing a strong greenhouse effect.
Venus rotates in the opposite direction compared to most other planets.

name: earth
composition: Rocky with oceans and a nitrogen-oxygen atmosphere
description: Our home planet, teeming with life and a diverse range of ecosystems.
interesting_facts: Earth is the only planet known to support life.
Its rotation is gradually slowing due to tidal interactions with the Moon.

name: mars
description: A cold and desolate planet with evidence of liquid water in the past.
interesting_facts: Mars has the largest volcano in the solar system, Olympus Mons.
It has a thin atmosphere composed mostly of carbon dioxide.

name: jupiter
composition: Primarily hydrogen and helium, with a small rocky core
description: The largest planet in our solar system, known for its massive size and powerful magnetic field.
interesting_facts: Jupiter has a strong magnetosphere and numerous moons, including the four Galilean moons.
It has a massive storm called the Great Red Spot, which has been raging for centuries.

name: saturn
composition: Primarily hydrogen and helium, with a small rocky core
description: Famous for its stunning ring system, Saturn is a gas giant with captivating features.
interesting_facts: Saturn's rings are made up of countless small particles of ice and rock.
It has a relatively low density and would float in water if a body of water large enough could be found.

name: uranus
composition: Primarily hydrogen and helium, with a water-ammonia ocean mantle
description: Uranus is an ice giant lying on its side, with a unique rotation axis.
interesting_facts: Uranus rotates on its side, with its poles facing the Sun in an almost perpendicular orientation.
It has a faint ring system and a blue-green hue due to the presence of methane in its atmosphere.

name: neptune
composition: Primarily hydrogen and helium, with a water-ammonia ocean mantle
description: Neptune is the farthest known planet in our solar system, with vivid blue coloration.
interesting_facts: Neptune has the fastest winds in the solar system, reaching speeds of up to 2,100 km/h.
Its blue color is a result of methane in its atmosphere absorbing red light.

name: proxima centauri b
description: An exoplanet located in the habitable zone of the red dwarf star Proxima Centauri.
interesting_facts: Proxima Centauri b is the closest known exoplanet to Earth, but its potential habitability is still debated.
It orbits its star in the habitable zone, where conditions might allow for liquid water on the surface.
